body.title: Getting started with the SPFE build system
body.p: You can run the SPFE build system on Windows or Linux. To begin building your documents with SPFE, you need to download SPFE from GitHub at https://github.com/mbakeranalecta/spfe-open-toolkit. You also need to ensure that you have the required third-party packages installed on your computer and your environment variables set up.

section.title: Installing third-party packages
section.p: To use the SPFE build system, you need to install Apache ANT and the Java Development Kit (JDK). Note that both ANT and SPFE require Java.

Visit http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/overview/index.html to get information about Java and to download the installer. If you use a Linux distribution that includes a package management system, such as RedHat or Debian, you may be able to install Java using the package manager. Ensure that you install the Java Deveopment Kit, not the Java Runtime Environment.

You can download ANT from http://ant.apache.org. If you use Linux, you may be able to install it using the package management system or by using an RPM from the website. For full installation instructions, follow the instructions in the ANT manual on the ANT website.

You also need to set up the SPFE environment variable SPFEOT_HOME and include it in your path. For example:

li.p: Windows: If you installed SPFE in C:\Users\youname\Documents: SPFEOT_HOME=C:\Users\yourname\Documents\spfe\spfe-ot
Linux: If you installed SPFE in /home/yourname: SPFEOT_HOME=/home/yourname/spfe/spfe-ot

section.title: Building the SPFE documentation
section.p: In the SPFEOT_HOME directory, you need to ensure that the file spfe uses the correct script for the operating system. By default, it uses the script for Linux (spfe.sh). If you use Windows, edit the spfe file and change the first line to spfe.bat.
To verify that you set up the build environment correctly, build the SPFE HTML documentation.

li.p: Open a terminal window and change to the directory <spfe-installation path>/spfe-docs/build.

section.p: The build system creates a directory spfebuild in your home directory. For example, in Windowa the directory C:\Users\yourname\spfebuild\spfe-docs\output contains the HTML files for the SPFE docs. Open the file spfebuild\spfe-docs\output\index.html in any standard browser. If you can view the SPFE Documentation in your browser, you have successfully set up your build environment and built the SPFE documents.
